alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Mason; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 11:32AM EDT until May 06 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Boyd County in northeastern Kentucky... Cabell County in central West Virginia... Southwestern Mason County in western West Virginia... Central Putnam County in western West Virginia... Northwestern Wayne County in western West Virginia... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 1132 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntington, Winfield, Beech Fork State Park, Hurricane, Barboursville, Kenova, Milton, Catlettsburg, Eleanor, Ceredo, Ona, Culloden, Teays Valley, Centerville, Burnaugh, Durbin, Bancroft, Pea Ridge, Fraziers Bottom and Lavalette. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
